citeinfo.title: Hillshade, LiDAR-derived, Minnesota
citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources and Minnesota Geospatial Information Office

descript.abstract: The hillshade is a black-and-white image showing elevation changes in the landscape. It is created from a digital elevation model as if the elevation surface were illuminated by a hypothetical light source shining from the northwest.
descript.purpose: Hillshades make it easier to visualize changes in elevation over a landscape. They can be used on their own or as a backdrop layer for other geographic data.

citeinfo.title: For more information about elevation data for Minnesota, see: http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/elevation/index.html

theme.themekey: elevation, LiDAR, DEM, digital elevation model, contour, topographic, topo, DTM, LAS, breakline, hillshade

idinfo.useconst: See Disclaimer field for complete use conditions.

timeperd.current: Hillshades were generated from a number of LiDAR datasets collected at different times. See the source metadata listed on the Minnesota LiDAR information webpage: http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/elevation/lidar.html

distinfo.distliab:
1. Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html
2. MnGeo's data disclaimer: http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/disclaimer.html

stdorder.ordering:
The hillshade image is available via MnGeo's Geospatial Image service (a WMS service); it is the "Hillshade (LiDAR)" layer. Click on the "I AGREE" link below for more information about the service and how to use it.
For more help with Minnesota's LiDAR data, see http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/elevation/lidar.html

procstep.procdesc:
Processing for about half the counties was done by the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources and the remaining counties were processed by the Minnesota Geospatial Information Office.
Hillshades were created from 1-meter source DEMs using the ArcGIS 10 Hillshade command. Default options were used: Altitude 45, Azimuth 315.
At MnGeo, the hillshades were exported from ArcGIS as grayscale images and were then imported into the Geospatial Image Service, a WMS service.

dataqual.complete: Complete except for large lakes for which no LiDAR data was collected.

attracc.attraccr: Several areas in Kanabec County have known highly visible major errors. The vendor who provided the original data has been notified of the problem.

horizpa.horizpar: Variable. See the source metadata listed on the Minnesota LiDAR information webpage: http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/elevation/lidar.html

vertacc.vertaccr: Variable. See the source metadata listed on the Minnesota LiDAR information webpage: http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/elevation/lidar.html

overview.eaover: The hillshade is a black-and-white image showing elevation changes in the landscape. It is created from a digital elevation model as if the elevation surface were illuminated by a hypothetical light source.
